body: Thanks, that's a good catch. Our logic probably looks at the wrong position.

> Thanks, that's a good catch. Our logic probably looks at the wrong position.

Hi, I am new to OSS I would like to work on this issue. Could you please give me some pointers to where I can find and address this issue?

Sure! Where the empty line (newline) should be removed is https://github.com/mvdan/gofumpt/blob/f2d9f32be31becb2f4d626dc07f83ca26268eb7f/format/format.go#L502. My guess is that we don't get there, likely because of this bit:

https://github.com/mvdan/gofumpt/blob/f2d9f32be31becb2f4d626dc07f83ca26268eb7f/format/format.go#L495-L499

That logic should be modified to allow gofumpt to remove the empty line in this particular case. That is, the function declaration is multi-line, but its last line begins with `)` without indentation, so there's no ambiguity with indentation.

> Sure! Where the empty line (newline) should be removed is
> 
> https://github.com/mvdan/gofumpt/blob/f2d9f32be31becb2f4d626dc07f83ca26268eb7f/format/format.go#L502

I understood this section, it should remove the empty lines.

> . My guess is that we don't get there, likely because of this bit:
> https://github.com/mvdan/gofumpt/blob/f2d9f32be31becb2f4d626dc07f83ca26268eb7f/format/format.go#L495-L499
> 
> That logic should be modified to allow gofumpt to remove the empty line in this particular case. That is, the function declaration is multi-line, but its last line begins with `)` without indentation, so there's no ambiguity with indentation.

***

> without indentation, so there's no ambiguity with indentation.

☝️  But I don't understand what you mean by this. Could you please explain further? Thank You!

I am trying to debug: https://github.com/mvdan/gofumpt/blob/f2d9f32be31becb2f4d626dc07f83ca26268eb7f/format/format.go#L495-L499 And I have created a textfile within `testdata` to test it. 

When I run the test I am unable to hit the break point for me to understand the code. Do you have any suggestions?

Thank You for the pointers.

issue.title: cmd/gofmt: remove leading/trailing blank lines from function bodies
issue.body:
What steps will reproduce the problem?

1. http://play.golang.org/p/Np4vGQFcqA
2. Hit Format.


What is the expected output? What do you see instead?

Want: Lines 6 and 13 removed.
Have: No change.


Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

Discussed with the community in
https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/golang-nuts/Z_s_tLTazJU

Based on that feedback, I propose that gofmt:

* remove trailing blank lines from function bodies
* remove leading blank lines when the function declaration is a single line

If this (or some variant thereof) gets an official blessing, I'd be happy to implement.
